header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends

header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, anecdote telling, making arrangements

well we used to have the family used to have a holiday home up in the Yorkshire Dales which is very remote and it was up the side of a massive mountain and there used to be an old monastery so a monastery where lots of monks stay and that was all derelict

falling apart
a ruin

so erm you had to go through about three fields and then there was in each field at the beginning and the end of a field there was a gate and you had to get out of the car and open the gate and let the car through and close the gate it was quite fun because we used to ride on the back of the car when we were young so the last gate is at the bottom of the drive and the drive was quite long to go up to the house it was about fifty metres to go up to the house and then there's a kitchen window that looks out and one time I saw this hooded figure from the window who was standing at the end of the drive and there was like no one else around so it was in the middle of nowhere and there was this hooded figure at the end of drive and I said to mummy mummy there's a man there's a man here she said what do you mean there's a man? and we looked and it was gone but there was no like you couldn't see anywhere else
he was hiding crouching down I reckon

probably not well people in the office have it so if I've made a mistake on a document okay and it was only a tiny error and I wanted to photocopy it then rather than print out the whole document I would use the Tippex to Tippex it out and then that error would be gone so when it got photocopied you wouldn't be able to see that mistake it does smell though so lots of silly people at school used to sort of sniff it and get all excited about it and mess it up you know pour it over their text books and stuff
